Introduction

Mina Sharon Myoi is a Japanese dancer and singer-songwriter under JYP Entertainment. She is best known as one of the main dancers of the sensational girl group TWICE. She is also a member of TWICE's Japanese subunit MISAMO.

Born on March 24, 1997, in San Antonio, Texas, she moved to Kobe, Japan when she was a toddler. In 2013, Mina was scouted by a JYP Entertainment staff while shopping with her mother. She passed the JYP Japan Audition and moved to South Korea where she began her journey as an official idol trainee. After two years, she participated in the survival show SIXTEEN where she ranked fourth place, securing her spot in the group.

She debuted in TWICE's sub-group, MISAMO, on July 26, 2023 with their first mini album, "Masterpiece."

Fun facts

1
Mina's English name is Sharon Myōi.

2
Mina loves ketchup, especially Heinz ketchup, and also, what she loves the most is egg with ketchup and she said that she can eat anything with ketchup.
…
3
Mina has a 17-year-old dachshund named Ray. Ray sadly died on January 29, 2024.
…
4
During TWICE's world tour, a photo of Mina went viral showcasing her abs. Later, the members looked at it in a vlog and Sana said Mina looks like Aquaman.
…
5
Mina plays APEX Legends, Minecraft, and builds Legos.
…
6
Mina wrote the lyrics for the song ''Shot Thru The Heart'' along with Momo and Sana.
…
7
Mina revealed that she is good friends with BLACKPINK's Lisa and they hang out together often.
…
8
Mina studied ballet for 11 years before joining Urizip Dance School for more modern dance training.
…
9
Mina has a brother and they rarely fight. The only thing they really fought about was who gets to use the gaming console.

10
Mina—recalling Jihyo mentioned being into pink lately—brought pink flowers for her when visiting during her 'Yes, I am Jihyo' Photobook shoot.
